functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: How old are the Japanese voice actors for the second year students in Tokyo Prefectural Jujutsu High School in the anime Jujutsu Kaisen?
How old are the Japanese voice actors for the second year students in Tokyo Prefectural Jujutsu High School in the anime Jujutsu Kaisen?

<document>
<title>Junichi Suwabe</title>
<fragment>

List of voice performances in anime television series, videos, specials, and films
| Year | Title | Role | Notes | Source[4] |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1999–2000 | *Great Teacher Onizuka* | Koji Fujiyoshi |  | [5] |
| 2001 | *The Prince of Tennis* | Keigo Atobe |  | [5] |
| 2001–02 | *X/1999* | Fūma Monou |  | [5] |
| 2003 | *E's Otherwise* | Leonid |  | [5] |
| 2003 | *Someday's Dreamers* | Masami Oyamada |  | [5] |
| 2003 | *Gad Guard* | Katana |  | [5] |
| 2003–04 | *Gilgamesh* | Tria |  | [5] |
| 2003–04 | *Peacemaker Kurogane* | Toshimaro Yoshida |  | [5] |
| 2004 | *Fullmetal Alchemist* | Greed |  | [5] |
| 2004 | *Tenjho Tenge* | Dan Inosato | Ep. 22 | [5] |
| 2004 | *Burst Angel* | Monitor Man B |  | [5] |
| 2004 | *DearS* | Hirofumi Nonaka |  | [5] |
| 2005 | *Trinity Blood* | Cain Nightroad |  | [5] |
| 2005 | *Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children* | Tseng |  | [5][6] |
| 2005 | *Last Order: Final Fantasy VII* | Tseng |  | [5] |
| 2005–09 | *Shakugan no Shana* | Friagne | Also movie | [5] |

</fragment>
<fragment>
| 2015–17 | *Star-Myu: High School Star Musical* | Itsuki Ōtori | season 2 in 2017 | [61] |
| 2016 | *Fate/Grand Order -First Order-* | Emiya |  | [5] |
| 2016 | *Kiznaiver* | Kazunao Yamada |  | [62] |
| 2016 | *Prince of Stride: Alternative* | Kyousuke Kuga |  | [63] |
| 2016 | *Twin Star Exorcists* | Seigen Amawaka |  | [64] |
| 2016 | *The Morose Mononokean* | Rippō |  | [65] |
| 2016–present | *My Hero Academia* | Shōta Aizawa, Jurota Shishida |  | [66] |
| 2016 | *Servamp* | World End |  |  |
| 2016 | *Thunderbolt Fantasy* | Shāng Bù Huàn | Puppet show | [67] |
| 2016 | *Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School* | Juzo Sakakura |  |  |
| 2016 | *Shokugeki no Souma: Ni no Sara* | Akira Hayama |  |  |
| 2016 | *Yuri!!! on Ice* | Viktor Nikiforov / Makkachin |  | [68] |
| 2016 | *Izetta: The Last Witch* | Berckmann or Belkmann |  |  |
| 2016 | *Bungo Stray Dogs* | Sakunosuke Oda |  |  |
| 2017 | *Interviews with Monster Girls* | Takahashi Tetsuo |  |  |

</fragment>
<fragment>
58. **^** "Junichi Suwabe, Kousuke Toriumi Join Hokuto no Ken: Ichigo Aji Anime's Cast". *Anime News Network*. August 16, 2015. Retrieved January 17, 2021.
59. **^** "Junichi Suwabe Also Voices Toki in Hokuto no Ken: Ichigo Aji Anime Adaptation". *Anime News Network*. August 21, 2015. Retrieved January 17, 2021.
60. **^** "World Trigger Anime Casts Tomokazu Sugita as Masato Kageura". *Anime News Network*. Retrieved December 3, 2019.
61. **^** "Kuroko/TeniPuri's Tada Helms High School Star Musical Anime". *Anime News Network*. Retrieved July 24, 2015.
62. **^** "Triggers original anime Kiznaiver cast additions introduce along with new promos". Crunchyroll. March 27, 2016. Retrieved May 17, 2020.
63. **^** "Prince of Stride Alternative TV Anime's Video Introduces Main Characters". *Anime News Network*. December 9, 2015. Retrieved December 10, 2015.
64. **^** "Twin Star Exorcists Anime Debuts in April, Casts Yū Serizawa & Junichi Suwabe". *Anime News Network*. February 3, 2016. Retrieved April 27, 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>

**Junichi Suwabe** (諏訪部 順一, *Suwabe Jun'ichi*, born March 29, 1972) is a Japanese voice actor from Tokyo. He is affiliated with Haikyō. His popular roles include Grimmjow Jaegerjaquez in *Bleach*, Omega Zero in *Megaman Zero 3*, Keigo Atobe in *The Prince of Tennis*, Victor Nikiforov in *Yuri!!! on ICE*, Freed Justine in *Fairy Tail*, Yami Sukehiro in *Black Clover*, Ryomen Sukuna in *Jujutsu Kaisen*, Archer in *Fate/stay night*, Ren Jinguji in *Uta no Prince-sama*, Undertaker in *Black Butler*, Leone Abbacchio in *JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Golden Wind*, Daiki Aomine in *Kuroko's Basketball*, Jurota Shishida and Shōta Aizawa in *My Hero Academia*, Dandy in *Space Dandy*, Bercouli Synthesis One in *Sword Art Online*, Akira Hayama alongside with Chinatsu Akasaki, Nobuhiko Okamoto & Yoshitsugu Matsuoka in *Food Wars! Shokugeki no Soma*, Dark Choco Cookie in *Cookie Run: Kingdom* and Shoei Barou in *Blue Lock*.

</fragment>
<fragment>
6. ^ ***a*** ***b*** ***c*** ***d*** ***e*** ***f*** ***g*** ***h*** ***i*** ***j*** ***k*** ***l*** ***m*** ***n*** ***o*** ***p*** ***q*** ***r*** ***s*** ***t*** ***u*** ***v*** ***w*** ***x*** ***y*** "Junichi Suwabe (visual voices guide)". *behindthevoiceactors.com*. Retrieved August 12, 2019. A green check mark indicates that a role has been confirmed using a screenshot (or collage of screenshots) of a title's list of voice actors and their respective characters found in its opening and/or closing credits and/or other reliable sources of information.`{{cite web}}`: CS1 maint: postscript (link)
7. **^** Oochi, Yoko (January 2007). "The Official Art of Fate/stay night". *Newtype USA*. Vol. 6, no. 1. Houston: A.D. Vision. pp. 101–107. ISSN 1541-4817.
8. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "Fate/stay night Unlimited Blade Works Film Confirmed (Updated)". *Anime News Network*. Retrieved July 24, 2015.
9. **^** "Vampire Knight's 2nd Season to Air in Japan in October". *Anime News Network*. Retrieved July 24, 2015.

</fragment>
<fragment>
* Kana Hanazawa / Miyuki Sawashiro (2015)
* Shizuka Itō / Saori Hayami (2016)
* Megumi Han (2017)
* Saori Ōnishi / Ayane Sakura (2018)
* Yu Serizawa / Nao Tōyama (2019)
* Atsumi Tanezaki (2020)
* Reina Ueda / Akari Kitō (2021)
* Mikako Komatsu / Rie Takahashi (2022)
 |
| Best Actor† (2023–present) | * Shūichi Ikeda / Ryotaro Okiayu / Atsumi Tanezaki (2023)
* Yōhei Azakami / Manaka Iwami / Mamiko Noto (2024)
 |
| † From 2023 (17th Seiyu Awards) onwards, the Actor/Actress Categories are merged as "Best Actor" with no gender distinction.
 |

|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| Authority control databases: Artists ![Edit this at Wikidata](image) | * MusicBrainz
 |

</fragment>
</document>

msg.content:
No page with that title exists. Try searching for one of these similar articles instead:
- Koki Uchiyama
- Yumi Uchiyama
- Violet Evergarden: Eternity and the Auto Memory Doll

msg.content:
The Japanese voice actors for the second-year students in Tokyo Prefectural Jujutsu High School in the anime "Jujutsu Kaisen" are:

1. **Junichi Suwabe** (voice of Ryomen Sukuna)
   - **Date of Birth:** March 29, 1972
   - **Age:** 51 years old

2. **Mikako Komatsu** (voice of Maki Zen'in)
   - **Date of Birth:** November 11, 1988
   - **Age:** 34 years old

I couldn't find specific information for Kouki Uchiyama, but based on the search results, it seems there might be a slight misspelling or confusion with the name. If you meant Koki Uchiyama, please let me know, and I can search again.
